title: Dr David Capes on how Paul interprets the Old Testament, the Divine Name, and Jesus as Lord
description:
Dr. David Capes is the Senior Research Fellow at the Lanier Theological Library in Houston, TX and distinguished New Testament Scholar. He is an expert on the Apostle Paul and New Testament study. His specific area of interest is how the Apostle Paul uses the Old Testament in the New Testament. In particular he focuses on how Paul will use OT passages about God and reapply them to be about Jesus in the NT and what the Christological implications of the hermeneutics are. He has written a book on the subject titled The Divine Christ. We delve into these topics these topics and more. We mention Earle Ellis, Larry Hurtado, Richard Bauckham, NT Wright, Bart Ehrman, James Dunn, Kyle Hughes, Crispin Fletcher-Louis, Philo of Alexandria, Justin Martyr and more. Hope you enjoy!

The Divine Christ by David Capes: https://www.amazon.com/Divine-Christ-Scriptures-Studies-Theology/dp/080109786X

David Capes Hayward Lectures: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=JqFOiBA36To&t=31s

00:00:00 - Intro and David's story
00:05:00 - David's academic background
00:06:45 - Paul's reading of the Old Testament
00:10:15 - Kurios, Lord, and the Divine Name
00:23:15 - What does divine mean?
00:34:15 - Was Jesus worshiped in the fullest sense of the word?
00:45:15 - YHWH texts applied to Jesus
00:57:00 - What does Paul mean by applying these passages to Jesus?
01:10:30 - What did Paul think Jesus preexisted as?
01:16:00 - Concluding Thoughts
